alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Cherokee; Houston; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:11AM CDT until April 16 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Houston, Anderson and Trinity Counties. For the Neches River...including Alto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Alto, Texas. * WHEN...From this Thursday evening to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment near the river to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The Neches River is expected to rise just above flood stage this Thursday evening to a crest of 16.1 feet by early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage by Friday morning near sunrise. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1045 AM CDT.
